comment: Really solid bottle. Better than regular Makers, which is always a great pour. The cherry notes are very present in this expression.  I paired it with a pomegranate after dinner, and that combo was mind-bending.
Tastes more like a regular whiskey than bourbon.
Very smooth. No burn at all for having such a high proof.
Sweet caramel and cherry start and then bitter cloves. A lingering finish with caramel and oak. Powerful and tasty
Alcohol and cherry on the nose, little to no burn going down, and slight linger on the finish.
Grabbed a bottle from Total Wine in Milford for 82 bucks.  Huge flavor, perfect bourbon to sip and watch movies in the winter.
55.35%, Oak Finishing Staves-Baked American Pure 2(1), Seared French Cuvée (5), Roasted French Mocha(3), Toasted French Spice(1)
It’s ok atm. Not worth the price
Got some heat and a little sweet
